title: Is it recommended to do CP

comments.body: I personally like to keep it above 18, so i don't have much experience with cp
Hopefully because it could land the OP in jail due to context issuesðŸ«¡ðŸ«¡
Bro could've worded it way better
Start with Neetcode if you're new to competitive programming and get your DSA basics cleared.

First off all, Start with leetcode, continue with CodeForces, Coding Ninjas daily problems, and keep solving daily   


One more advice, If you cannot solve (includes coding time) any problem there within 45 minutes - 1 hour, then jump to best solution and try to understand what they have done, understand the Data structures used, algorithms used. 

  
Ideally , this is how I do as well. Competitive Programming improved your problem solving skills to a great extent, and campus interviews will be a cake walk if you master at any early age.
Is there any club or something i can join which can help me in it???
Yes, Join the Alcoding Club - RR Campus
